articles.headline: Another Super Bowl Ad Fest, This Time on the Cellphone
articles.snippet: This year, a new kind of advertising — personalized and based on physical location down to a matter of feet — will greet fans in Times Square and MetLife Stadium, where the Super Bowl will be played this weekend.
articles.abstract: This year, a new kind of advertising — personalized and based on physical location down to a matter of feet — will greet fans in Times Square and MetLife Stadium, where the Super Bowl will be played this weekend.
articles.lead_paragraph: Want to see the Vince Lombardi Trophy that goes to the Super Bowl winner? Take a left in 15 feet. Looking to buy some Super Bowl merchandise? Try the fourth floor of Macy’s, straight ahead.

articles.headline: Dark Side of Capital in Emerging Markets
articles.snippet: For countries like Turkey, the tide of investment from abroad has turned.
articles.abstract: For countries like Turkey, the tide of investment from abroad has turned.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is no fun to be a central banker in an emerging-market country when investors suddenly grow doubtful.

articles.headline: U.S. Is Seeking Death Penalty in Boston Case
articles.snippet: The decision against Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, accused of killing and maiming people with homemade bombs at the Boston Marathon last year, is not necessarily final, because such cases often end in plea deals.
articles.abstract: The decision against Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, accused of killing and maiming people with homemade bombs at the Boston Marathon last year, is not necessarily final, because such cases often end in plea deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Justice Department said Thursday that it would seek the death penalty against Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the man accused of killing and maiming people with homemade bombs at the Boston Marathon finish line last year.

articles.headline: N.S.A. Choice Is Navy Expert on Cyberwar
articles.snippet: Vice Adm. Michael S. Rogers, a cryptologist by training, will become the public face of the N.S.A. at a moment that it is caught in the cross hairs of a roiling debate.
articles.abstract: Vice Adm. Michael S. Rogers, a cryptologist by training, will become the public face of the N.S.A. at a moment that it is caught in the cross hairs of a roiling debate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In nominating Vice Adm. Michael S. Rogers as the new director of the National Security Agency on Thursday, President Obama chose a recognized expert in the new art of designing cyberweapons, but someone with no public track record in addressing the kinds of privacy concerns that have put the agency under a harsh spotlight.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Thom Shanker

articles.headline: Amazon to Raise Fees as Revenue Disappoints
articles.snippet: Revenue rose 20 percent, but the online retailer said it was considering raising prices by as much as 50 percent on its $79 Prime shipping program.
articles.abstract: Revenue rose 20 percent, but the online retailer said it was considering raising prices by as much as 50 percent on its $79 Prime shipping program.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Amazon investors might have finally heard the news they have been waiting for: The retailer is raising shipping fees.

articles.headline: Its Great Lake Shriveled, Iran Confronts Crisis of Water Supply
articles.snippet: President Hassan Rouhani has identified water as a national security issue, and nowhere is the crisis more pronounced than at Lake Urmia, once one of the largest salt lakes in the world.
articles.abstract: President Hassan Rouhani has identified water as a national security issue, and nowhere is the crisis more pronounced than at Lake Urmia, once one of the largest salt lakes in the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAKE URMIA, Iran — After driving for 15 minutes over the bottom of what was once Iran’s largest lake, a local environmental official stepped out of his truck, pushed his hands deep into his pockets and silently wandered into the great dry plain, as if searching for water he knew he would never find.

articles.headline: In the Event of an Air Emergency, Remember What Alf Said
articles.snippet: You’ve heard it all before, so airlines are enlivening their in-flight safety videos, while bringing buzz to their brands.
articles.abstract: You’ve heard it all before, so airlines are enlivening their in-flight safety videos, while bringing buzz to their brands.
articles.lead_paragraph: The spoof movie “Airplane!” is becoming the basis for something real, 34 years after its release.

articles.headline: In Landrieu Races, Obama Helps and Hinders
articles.snippet: Two Landrieus face re-election in campaigns that are complicated by the currents of race and history that run through Louisiana, but also by national factors, chief among which is President Obama.
articles.abstract: Two Landrieus face re-election in campaigns that are complicated by the currents of race and history that run through Louisiana, but also by national factors, chief among which is President Obama.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW ORLEANS — On a recent morning, Senator Mary L. Landrieu of Louisiana woke up in her childhood bedroom, drank coffee with her parents and headed downtown to help her little brother Mitch keep his job.

articles.headline: GoPro Sees Opportunity in Its Amateur Daredevils
articles.snippet: The company, whose camera has become a tool of choice for recording skiing, surfing and other adrenaline-soaked exploits, is now setting its sights on becoming a media company.
articles.abstract: The company, whose camera has become a tool of choice for recording skiing, surfing and other adrenaline-soaked exploits, is now setting its sights on becoming a media company.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN MATEO, Calif. — Inside the headquarters of GoPro, the video camera maker, there is a racing car, a collection of motorcycles, and drones outfitted with the company’s products. All of them are reminders of the niche that GoPro has carved out as the camera of choice for recording skiing, surfing and other experiences too gnarly for dainty smartphones.
